properties.Name: PolicyLoan
properties.Description:
An amount of money borrowed by the insured using the cash value of his life insurance policy as security.

A loan is a loan against one's own money.    It is withdrawn with either the presumption that it will be repaid or the understanding that by not repaying it the amount of future benefits including the death benefit will be reduced by the loaned amount (plus accrued interest).

Columns.Name: LoanId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Loan.

Columns.Name: LoanDate
Columns.Description: The date that the loan was granted.

Columns.Name: LoanPeriod
Columns.Description: The total length of the loan expressed in months.

Columns.Name: LoanPaymentPeriods
Columns.Description: The period method upon which loan payments are to be made.

Columns.Name: LoanPaymentAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of each regular period loan payment.

Columns.Name: LoanLifeInterestAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of interest that is to be paid over the course of the life of the loan.

Columns.Name: LoanPercentage
Columns.Description: The interest rate percentage applied to the loan.

Columns.Name: LoanGuarantorName
Columns.Description: The name of the party guaranteeing the loan.

Columns.Name: LoanApplicationDate
Columns.Description: The date that the loan was applied for.

Columns.Name: LoanAuthorizedDate
Columns.Description: The date that the loan was authorized.

Columns.Name: LoanPaidDate
Columns.Description: The date that the loan was paid off.

Columns.Name: InsurancePolicyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Insurance Policy.

Properties.Description:
An amount of money borrowed by the insured using the cash value of his life insurance policy as security.

A loan is a loan against one's own money.    It is withdrawn with either the presumption that it will be repaid or the understanding that by not repaying it the amount of future benefits including the death benefit will be reduced by the loaned amount (plus accrued interest).
